newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian wool indicator steady on 614 c/kg.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian wool indicator steady on 614 c/kg.

text.p: The Australian wool market's eastern indicator closed unchanged at 614 cents a kg clean at auctions in Sydney and Adelaide on Thursday, Wool International (WI) said.
In merino fleece, 19/20 micron were unchanged, 21/24/25m slightly dearer, 22/23m up to 0.5 percent cheaper and 26m 0.5 percent dearer, it said.
Merino skirtings were up to 1.0 percent dearer.
In crossbreds, 27/29/30/31m were unchanged, while 28m was slightly dearer.
In cardings, lambs were fully firm, locks up to 1.0 percent dearer and crutchings unchanged.
There was good general competition with most sectors of the trade active, WI said.
Of the 22,338 bales offered in Sydney and Adelaide, 9.3 percent were passed in.
Sales continue next week in Sydney and Melbourne with about 57,000 bales on offer.
